main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Tampa, Florida in November 1957, involving observations of bright and bell-shaped objects, fast-moving orbs, and a ball of fire with a white streak behind it.
interesting points: An object the size of half a moon and moving at high speeds was observed shooting from southwest to northeast before disappearing abruptly.
Several objects were spotted on radar traveling at high speed, but attempts to intercept them were unsuccessful.
A bright ball of fire, half the size of the moon, was observed with a loud explosion and disappeared as if its light went out, leading to the conclusion of a possible meteor sighting.
The visual observation of a bright object moving very fast, disappearing and reappearing over a span of 30 minutes, which was ultimately explained as a probable balloon.
A civilian reported seeing a bright ball of fire, egg-shaped and half the size of a B-47 aircraft, with a red front and blue rear, accompanied by a white streak behind it.
sighted object: bell-shaped object, orbs, ball of fire
photographs: no photographs included in the reports
